TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to James F Perry, 05-10-1834

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to James F. Perry, May 10, 1834. Describing prison and his imprisonment incomunicado. Observations on his past policy in Texas.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Biographical sketch in Bancroft, History of Mexico, IV, 451. For Almonte's mission to Texas, see Barker, The Life of Stephen F. Austin, 462-466.

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, May 10, 1834. Describing prison and his imprisonment incomunicado. Observations on his past policy in Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Ex-inquisicion*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-10-1834">May 10th 1834*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I improve the first moment that I could write to you since I arrived here which was on the *date_mentioned n="02-13-1834">13 Feby—*/date_mentioned*on that day I was locked up in one of the *location_mentioned*dungeons */location_mentioned*of this vast building incomunicado, that is I was not allowed to speak to, or communicate with any person whatever except the *person_mentioned*officer of the guard*/person_mentioned*. I remained in this situation untill *date_mentioned n="05-09-1834">yesterday */date_mentioned*when I was permitted to communicate with persons outside, receive books, writing materials, visits etc and to mix with the other *person_mentioned*prisoners*/person_mentioned*—there are about 60 of them, all *person_mentioned*officers*/person_mentioned* except two *person_mentioned*clergymen (Padres)*/person_mentioned* and all men of good *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*and respectability confined for political opinions in the revolution of the past year. The occupant of my *location_mentioned*dungeon */location_mentioned*before me was a *person_mentioned*Col*/person_mentioned*. who was banished. *person_mentioned*General Bustamante former vice-President*/person_mentioned* occupied one in *date_mentioned n="07-xx-1833">July */date_mentioned*and *date_mentioned n="08-xx-1833">August */date_mentioned*last near mine, as I am informed*/p*.
*p*You may have some curiosity to know how I am lodged and what sort of a place an *location_mentioned*inquisición prison*/location_mentioned* is, about which so many horrid things are said all over the *location_mentioned*world*/location_mentioned*, and which are no doubt true and probably much worse.*/p*
*p*My *location_mentioned*room */location_mentioned*is about 16 feet by 13—very high ceiling—two doors, one flush with the outside surface of the wall, the other near the inside surface and within the wall which is about 3 feet thick of large hewn stone—the latter door has an oblong hole large enough to admit a plate—the other is solid, both were always locked and bolted untill *date_mentioned n="05-09-1834">yesterday*/date_mentioned*—no windows—a very small sky-light in the roof which barely afforded light to read on very clear days when the sun was high, say from 10 to 3 o'clock—quite free from damp except such as would naturally result from the want of a free circulation of air. There are 19 similar *location_mentioned*dungeons */location_mentioned*in this range with the difference that some of them are a little larger than mine, tho most are the same size—they are *location_mentioned*in the interior of this extensive building*/location_mentioned* and the doors open into an oblong*location_mentioned* patio */location_mentioned*or open court about 120 by 60 feet which has a varanda or gallery all round it supported by pillars and arches—a fountain of good water from the acqueduct in the centre. This part of the building is one story but is surrounded on every side by other parts of the same building that are two stories and present a solid wall above our range without windows that look into this patio. On two sides of the base of the two story wall before mentioned there are *location_mentioned*solederos or sunning places*/location_mentioned* which are spaces about 14 feet square (one is much larger) ranged along the back of the *location_mentioned*dungeons */location_mentioned*and between them and the before mentioned two story wall—they are separated from each other by high walls—each has a door, locks etc—open above for the sun— they communicate with the patio by arched passages*/p*.
*p*When I came in each *location_mentioned*dungeon */location_mentioned*had its occupant and all were incomunicado the same as myself. All the doors were locked and bolted no one came into the *location_mentioned*patio */location_mentioned*except the *person_mentioned*sentinel*/person_mentioned*—all was silent- each one was taken out about two hours the middle of the day and put into one of the *location_mentioned*solederos */location_mentioned*or sunning places, alone and locked in. In time of the inquisición the *person_mentioned*prisoners */person_mentioned*were covered with a kind of sack or over garment with a mask at the top to cover the head and face, so that they could not be known, even by the guard in going through the *location_mentioned*patio */location_mentioned*to and from the *location_mentioned*solederos*/location_mentioned*, nothing of the kind was done with us, we saw each other but could not salute or speak. I am told that in the time of the inquisición there were four other *location_mentioned*patios */location_mentioned*or open courts that belonged to the part of the building that was used as a *location_mentioned*prison*/location_mentioned*—they formerly communicated with each other by obscure passages which are now closed. The entrance into each from the street was always separate as they still are so that if the *person_mentioned*friend of a prisoner*/person_mentioned* saw him enter one of the outside doors, he could not from that circumstance form any idea of the *location_mentioned*patio */location_mentioned*or part of the building where he was confined. The *location_mentioned*patio */location_mentioned*I am in communicates with the street by a narrow dark passage about 150 feet long.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Padre Servando Mier*/person_mentioned* a very distinguished *person_mentioned*patriot */person_mentioned*was confined in the same *location_mentioned*dungeon */location_mentioned*I am in by the *person_mentioned*tribunal of the inquisición*/person_mentioned* in its time, and also by the *person_mentioned*emperor Iturbide*/person_mentioned*. I visited him here in this room in *date_mentioned n="10-xx-1822">October 1822*/date_mentioned*, he was a *person_mentioned*member of congress*/person_mentioned* and was arrested the *date_mentioned n="08-20-1822">20 of August*/date_mentioned* with *person_mentioned*14 other members*/person_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*General Morelos */person_mentioned*the most distinguished of the *person_mentioned*generals */person_mentioned*in the beginning of the revolution, was confined in a *location_mentioned*dungeon */location_mentioned*near mine in this range from which he was taken to be shot. In short each of these *location_mentioned*dungeons */location_mentioned*has some tradition of the sufferings of some *person_mentioned*victim of the inquisición */person_mentioned*or of the revolution. Since the Independence this building has been used as a *location_mentioned*prison */location_mentioned*for political opinions or offences—no one accused of felonious crimes is confined here. The *person_mentioned*prisoners */person_mentioned*are well treated.*/p*
*p*The *date_mentioned n="04-01-1834">first of April*/date_mentioned* all the *person_mentioned*prisoners */person_mentioned*were put in communication except myself and four others we remained shut up untill *date_mentioned n="05-09-1834">yesterday*/date_mentioned*—our doors are now open from sun rise to 9 o'clock at night— we have the free use of the *location_mentioned*patio */location_mentioned*and can visit another extensive range of *location_mentioned*dungeons */location_mentioned*in the 2d story of the main building which communicates with this patio by a dark passage and much darker stone staircase. From this range there is a passage onto the *location_mentioned*asotea or roof of our range of dungeons*/location_mentioned* which is flat so that we can walk over our *location_mentioned*dungeons */location_mentioned*and all around our patio and have sufficient room for exercise I was shewn a *location_mentioned*dungeon */location_mentioned*in the 2d story where a man from *location_mentioned*Guatamala */location_mentioned*was confined by the inquiscion 30 years he is now living in a *location_mentioned*hospital */location_mentioned*of this city and has given some account of the treatment of *person_mentioned*prisoners */person_mentioned*in those days of superstition and despotism*/p*
*p*I have received no personal ill treatment from any of the *person_mentioned*officers*/person_mentioned* or *person_mentioned*guards */person_mentioned*who have had charge of me since my first arrest up to this day I received such provisions as I needed them through the guard—they were handed in at the hole in the inside door. When I left *location_mentioned*Monterey */location_mentioned*the *person_mentioned*officer of the guard, Cap Manuel Barragan*/person_mentioned*, told me that he would put no guard over me except my word that I would not attempt to escape nor speak or write to any one without his permission. I gave it of course, for I would have returned to *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned* on the simple order of the *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*my conscience told me that I had committed no crime. I was imprudent in urging the claims of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* that were confided to me as an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*with more determination and obstenancy than was consistent with my personal security or wellfare, but nothing more. I accepted the agency with reluctance, but in good faith and conformed to what I had every right to believe was the general wish of the people so far as the convention expressed that wish. Much good will result to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*from my sufferings. The *person_mentioned*state government*/person_mentioned* have been stimulated to apply proper remedies in many things and some of those who would have ruined the country and thrown it into confusion merely from personal feelings and low mean jealousies towards me, are now satisfied and rejoicing and are in favor of peace and quietness, because they think I am suffering- others who were restless and dissatisfied with me and with every thing without knowing why, are more calm and reasonable, and others who were my *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*a year ago, have no doubt had the magninimity to do me justice— this conduct (if it be true as I am told it is) will do them honor and be remembered to their advantage at some future day when all personal feelings have passed away. My own personal *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*(and the mass of the honest and laboring *person_mentioned*farmers*/person_mentioned* are so) have always been in favor of peace and quietness and opposed to turbulence. They have no doubt blamed me for suffering violent men to involve me as I have been. They have seen that I have permitted myself to be thrown into the mire by others whose sole object was my ruin. I was unsuspicious and acted in good faith—the fact is that when a few persons combine to ruin another who is unsuspicious and acts in good faith and with honest intentions, it is very difficult for him to escape.*/p*
*p*Thus it is, that those who a year ago were the most anxious for a state and the most turbulent, are now for peace—they have in fact adopted my own principles which allways have been peace quietness, patience and submission to the laws and no revolutions. If I ever wandered from those principles, it was because the public feeling was so disordered and things were so disjointed that my opposition would have increased the evils and in all probability caused a great deal of confusion. I yielded from this motive, and yielded in good faith, and not to undermine or counteract. Thus my own principles of peace and quietness are now predominant, when had I attempted to have made them prevail by direct opposition to violent measures the reverse would have been the case.*/p*
*p*It is very evident that *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*must become a state at some future day and not very distant—all will be in favor of it— the attempt that has been made was premature and totally wrong as to the manner. The particular act that involved me in all this, was the calling of the convention in my absence. I yielded after my return. So far as I am to blame in agreeing to those measures I am ready to be censured—they grew out of the situation of public feelings at the time—it would have been worse than useless for me to have opposed them—the only way I could have done it was to enter into the thing in bad faith so as to defeat and counteract. Such a course I did not think was correct or honorable— on my arrival here I could have put the state question to sleep. If I had done so those who now blame me for an excess of zeal would have been vociferous on the opposite extreem. All those things are mere matters of course—in short it is mankind. The only substantial matter in this business that is worthy of consideration is that much substantial good will result to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*from my sufferings and I am content— as to office or public employ you know that I have always been averse to it—I am more so now than ever— I am no *person_mentioned*office hunter*/person_mentioned* nor no *person_mentioned*demagogue */person_mentioned*seeking popularity— I have tryed in good faith to do all the good I could to everybody—as to *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*— the common acceptation of those words amongst mankind in general conveys to the mind the same idea of change, that the word clouds does— not so with true personal friends— of these I shall never want. Such men for example as *person_mentioned*T. F. McKinney*/person_mentioned*. These are the only kind of friends I wish for.*/p*
*p*I have no idea when I shall be at liberty. I think that all depends on the report of *person_mentioned*Almonte */person_mentioned*who has been sent to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and I presume is now there or on his way back. It is much in my favor that all remains quiet in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*I was confident that no *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*of mine would try to get up an excitement but I feared that my *person_mentioned*enemies*/person_mentioned* would. Such a thing would have increased my difficulty, for I would have been blamed for it all. My confinement has been very rigid but I am in good health and have borne it with tolerable patience. I had no books the first month, and it was solitary enough—after that I prevailed on the *person_mentioned*sergeant */person_mentioned*to go to *person_mentioned*D. Victor Blanco*/person_mentioned* who sent them—he and *person_mentioned*Padre Muldoon*/person_mentioned* have been firm and unwavering in their friendship to me in all this business, so has *person_mentioned*Ramon Musquis*/person_mentioned* and many others in *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*who have written here in my favor I have never complained of the *person_mentioned*Vice President Farias*/person_mentioned*—he has been deceived—he has been made to believe, as I am told, that my object was to separate *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*from *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*and deliver it to the *location_mentioned*United States of the north*/location_mentioned*, which is absolutely false and without the shadow of foundation besides being a great absurdity. In a moment of irritation I said to the *person_mentioned*vice President*/person_mentioned* that if the evils of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* were not remedied the public there would remedy them of themselves— this irritated him very much and my difficulties com- menced. The truth is I lost patience and was imprudent and of course to blame, for patience is necessary in such cases. I hope that no friend of mine will blame the *person_mentioned*vice President*/person_mentioned* or complain of him. I put on one side all considerations of personal safety or consequences to myself and thought only of suffering *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and the fevered and excited situation of my constituents—had I erred from a want of zeal or industry or dilligence in the discharges of my duty as an *person_mentioned*agent*/person_mentioned*, all would have had cause to censure me and my own conscience would have been the first to do it, for nothing can be more sacred than a public agency. My conscience is at rest- as an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*I did my duty, or, only erred from excess of zeal to do it—good has resulted even from that error if it was one. I am suffering but the evils of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*are remedied— this idea consoles me for my misfortunes and enables me to bear them firmly. Remember me to *person_mentioned*McKinney */person_mentioned*and show him this letter also *person_mentioned*H. Austin*/person_mentioned* and if *person_mentioned*Mason */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Hotchkiss */person_mentioned*are there remember me to them.*/p*
*p*Love to *person_mentioned*Emily */person_mentioned*and all the *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*N. B. I sent you two mineatures from *location_mentioned*Monterey */location_mentioned*by *person_mentioned*Mr. Powel*/person_mentioned* which I hope you have recd. The small one was taken the beginning of *date_mentioned n="10-xx-1833">October */date_mentioned*when things were very unfavourable for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* and I was not in a pleasant humour of course it therefore has rather a cross or frowning look—the other that is the large one was taken in *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1833">November */date_mentioned*when all was right. *person_mentioned*Mr Howard*/person_mentioned* who painted them has gone to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and I recommend him to you very particularly as a good *person_mentioned*artist */person_mentioned*and a very good worthy young man. If *person_mentioned*Hotchkiss */person_mentioned*is in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*remember me to him very particularly-—he is an honorable and high minded man—his friendship is valuable for he has no deception—he will no doubt blame me very much for writing the letter of *date_mentioned n="10-02-1833">2d of October*/date_mentioned* don't mind that—I blame myself because it was the imprudent act of an excited impatient moment. If I find that I am to be detained here long, I will send you a power of attorney to sell any of my property you think proper and make titles. I send you an extra-judicial power under which you can act if you think proper—-deeds may be wanted for the *location_mentioned*Brazoria */location_mentioned*lots and perhaps you may do some thing with *location_mentioned*the place at the mouth of the river west side*/location_mentioned*. Do as you please with anything of mine and try and have a room for me at your *location_mentioned*house*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="05-10-1834">May 10 1834*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Mr James F. Perry*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I know nothing about the political situation of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*but am told it is very unsettled—some say worse than it has ever been—party spirit is more bitter and vindicative—some think there will be another civil war worse than any of the others. These are the rumors which reach us in the *location_mentioned*Patio */location_mentioned*whether true or false God knows*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. A.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
